body_html:
If you see https://gist.github.com/ggordonhall/175817c36549ef17f9a3465c383ca492#file-gistfile1-txt-L4165-L4171 it says it found PyTorch's own source-compiled NCCL1. This happens because NCCL2 wasn't auto-detected / found.

Can you export:

export NCCL_ROOT_DIR=[path to your NCCL2]

And then recompile PyTorch.

For example, my $NCCL_ROOT_DIR has the contents:

$ ls  $NCCL_ROOT_DIR
COPYRIGHT.txt  include  lib  NCCL-SLA.txt

body:
If you see https://gist.github.com/ggordonhall/175817c36549ef17f9a3465c383ca492#file-gistfile1-txt-L4165-L4171 it says it found PyTorch's own source-compiled NCCL1. This happens because NCCL2 wasn't auto-detected / found.

Can you export:

```
export NCCL_ROOT_DIR=[path to your NCCL2]
```

And then recompile PyTorch.

For example, my $NCCL_ROOT_DIR has the contents:

```
$ ls  $NCCL_ROOT_DIR
COPYRIGHT.txt  include  lib  NCCL-SLA.txt
```
